text: The 1999–2000 Czech First League, known as the Gambrinus liga for sponsorship reasons, was the seventh season of top-tier football in the Czech Republic. ==Stadia and locations== ==League standings== ==Top goalscorers== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Player !Club !Goals |- !1 |align="left"| Vratislav Lokvenc |align="left"|Sparta Prague |22 |- !2 |align="left"| Marek Kincl |align="left"|Slovan Liberec / Viktoria Žižkov |16 |- !3 |align="left"| Stanislav Vlček |align="left"|Sigma Olomouc |13 |- !rowspan="4"|4 |align="left"| Vítězslav Tuma |align="left"|Drnovice |rowspan="4"|11 |- |align="left"| Tomáš Janda |align="left"|České Budějovice |- |align="left"| Tomáš Došek |align="left"|Slavia Prague |- |align="left"| Horst Siegl |align="left"|Sparta Prague |} ==See also== * 1999–2000 Czech Cup * 1999–2000 Czech 2. Liga ==References== * ČMFS statistics Category:Czech First League seasons Czech Category:1999–2000 in Czech football
title: 1999–2000 Czech First League
